article-info: How do I search for flights on Skyscanner?
article-description: We know you're looking for the best prices to choose the right flight for your trip.
article-description 2: To start your search, open up Skyscanner's search pages  Enter the  in the  and fields. Enter your  in the  and  fields, then click  A list of flight options will appear.
article-description 12: When you've seen a suitable flight for your needs, you can click on , and we'll show you a list of airlines and travel agencies so you can book directly with them.
article-description 14: You can then use search filters, such as the number of stops and departure time, to help you find the perfect flight.
article-description 15: If you're looking for inspiration for your next trip, why not try our , which helps you see endless destinations at every price from thousands of travel sites in one place. Or, if you're flexible on dates, you can use our Whole month view to find the cheapest time to travel.
article-description 17: We've got lots of tips and tricks to help you save more on our

article-info: How do I search for multiple destinations?
article-description: The Multi-city search option is available in the destination field. First, enter the departure city, airport or country in the field, and then in the field, there is an option for a  search. These options are the same for both our and There is also a  button on our main flight search page.
article-description 2: Selecting the Multi-city search option will enable you to add multiple searches for different airports and dates.
article-description 12: Multi-city flights are a smart way to see more destinations in one go by adding extra legs to your trip. If, for example, you can't decide between Paris or Rome, you can book flights to both cities and turn your trip into an itinerary.
article-description 14: You can enter up to six legs of your journey, selecting your departure airport, destination and dates from the drop-down menus.
article-description 15: More information about how to search for multiple destinations can be found in .

article-info: How do I search for one way flights?
article-description: By default, Skyscanner’s search is set up for return flights. However, it’s simple to change to one way. Whether you’re on our website, mobile website or app, you can search for one way flights by selecting the ‘one way’ option above the ‘From’ (departure airport) field.
article-description 2: To change back to return flights, simply re-select ‘Return’, or click in the return date field, and you’ll be able to search for return flights again.

article-info: How do I change my password?
article-description: You no longer need to use a password to access your Skyscanner account. Instead, you can now use verification authentication.
article-description 2: There are four ways you can use verification authentication to access your Skyscanner account.
article-description 3: - You will need to be signed in to your Apple account which will likely be a two-factor authentication. Once you are logged into your Apple account, you will only need to enter your Apple ID to access your Skyscanner account.
article-description 5: - You can sign in to your Skyscanner account by entering your email address. After you enter your email address, we will email you a 4-digit verification code. Enter the 4-digit code on the next screen, and you will be logged in.
article-description 6: - You will need to be signed in to your Facebook account. Once logged in, you only need to enter your login to access your Skyscanner account.
article-description 8: - You will need to be signed in to your Google account. Once logged in, you only need to enter your Google ID to access your Skyscanner account.

article-info: Stop overs
article-description: At the moment, Skyscanner doesn’t show flights that include a stopover, but we plan to offer this feature in the near future.
article-description 2: In the meantime, some airlines and travel agents may allow you to do this directly on their sites, so you can still do your search on Skyscanner and then contact them directly once you can see the travel options, and they may be able to help.

article-info: Direct flights
article-description: If you want to search for direct flights, the method varies slightly depending on your device.
article-description 2: On desktop and mobile web, click the “Direct flights only” button at the bottom of the search controls.
article-description 12: If you are using our Android or iOS app you can tap on "Sort & filter" on the results page, on the top right corner of the screen.

article-info: Group bookings
Child/infant fares and children travelling alone
article-description: Some airlines might offer discounted airfares for children and/or infants. To help give you the most accurate flight prices and help you rest easy, we always ask for the ages of your children at the time of travel.
article-description 3: Once you have entered your passenger information, we display our flight search results to show the  (given to us by the airline/travel agent) for
article-description 6: We don’t have the prices that make up this total but, to help you compare flights, we show the  price per person. This is the total group price, divided by the number of passengers –
article-description 8: If fare prices are cheaper for any children or infants travelling, you can be assured that we have  taken these discounts into account in the total price.
article-description 10: Travelling families: Prices for children and infants
article-description 12: Once you have selected a flight, we will usually redirect you to the airline or travel agent's website where you will be able to see the fare price breakdown for all individuals travelling. We recommend checking this information carefully before you book, however the total price for all passengers should match the total price you were shown on Skyscanner.
article-description 15: Some airlines have different rules and prices for people under age  who are travelling alone. We recommend you check this information with your chosen airline or travel agent before you book.

article-info: Open return
article-description: We’re not currently able to show open return tickets on Skyscanner.
article-description 2: However, some airlines and travel agents may still allow you to do this directly on their sites. You can therefore still do your search on Skyscanner, and then contact the travel provider (airline or travel agent) directly once you can see the travel options, and they should be able to help.
article-description 12: You should be able to find the contact details of the travel provider who sold you the tickets using the search below, but please drop us a line via the Contact Us link if you still need a hand.

article-info: First Class, Business Class or Premium Economy tickets
article-description: You can choose the cabin class (Economy, First Class, Business Class, or Premium Economy) before you begin your search.
article-description 2: On our , click on the  field to choose your preferred cabin class from the drop-down menu.
article-description 12: On our  tap the  field and pick your preferred cabin class from the drop-down menu.
article-description 14: If you want to view results for another cabin class, adjust the selection in the drop-down menu and search again
article-description 15: You can search for premium class fares only when you are looking for specific locations or dates.

article-info: Skyscanner Quality Rating Score
article-description: whether travellers are able to complete the payment process smoothly.
article-description 3: how well the provider’s prices match the prices on Skyscanner, and whether any fees and charges are clearly shown.
article-description 5: does the provider have a clear refund or change policy for each ticket? Is the policy easy to find during the booking process?
article-description 6: whether flights selected on Skyscanner are consistently available on the provider’s site.
article-description 8: how easy to use and stable the provider’s site is during the booking process.
article-description 11: After you’ve visited a travel provider site from Skyscanner, we show a survey asking for feedback about your experience with that provider. We combine those survey results with any post-booking feedback received by our Support Team about each travel provider to generate an overall quality rating. To make sure that the quality rating is relevant and up-to-date, we only take into account feedback from the last 91 days, and we refresh the scores weekly.
article-description 12: how easy is it for travellers to contact the provider for help, as well as any concerns about their service and reliability.
article-description 14: Our ratings are never influenced by us, or by our travel providers.

article-info: What does it mean when I see Self-transfer on Skyscanner?
article-description: At Skyscanner, we want to help you have the best travel experience possible. And we know that saving money on flights in one way to do that.
article-description 2: So, when you search for flights, we'll show you all the options to help you get the most value possible. Sometimes, certain cheaper options might carry some risk. That's why they cost less.
article-description 4: What does a self-transfer mean for you?
article-description 5: Baggage allowances may also vary by ticket. At the end of your first flight, you'll likely need to pick up your checked baggage and recheck it for your second flight. You might need to pass through security and passport control during each connection (for international flights). You'll also sometimes need a visa if your connection is in a country that requires one.
article-description 6: In summary, self-transfer tickets often offer attractive prices, but you need to be aware of the above before confirming your booking.
article-description 8: You'll likely have two tickets, each with a separate cancellation or change policy. If anything causes a delay or cancellation of your first flight, you may miss your second flight and have to buy another ticket.
article-description 9: Some of our travel providers offer Transfer protection.
article-description 10: Transfer protection means that the provider has some kind of connection guarantee, and may help you if something goes wrong (e.g. by booking replacement flights for you).
article-description 11: Different providers have different policies for Transfer protection. We'll therefore tell you when a provider is offering transfer protection, and you'll need to find more information once you have been transferred to their site to complete your booking.
article-description 12: Before you book, we want to help you understand what you're signing up for.
article-description 14: A self-transfer flight means you will have two or more flights to reach your destination. Two different airlines could operate the two flights, but not always. It's also possible that your second flight leaves from another airport to the one you arrived at (we'll always make this clear). You'll then need to transfer yourself from one flight to the next.
article-description 15: To help you choose, we'll let you know when the flight you are looking for is a self-transfer.
article-description 17: If different airlines from the same alliance (i.e. SkyTeam, Star Alliance etc.) operate your flights, we won't label it as a self-transfer flight. The airlines will transfer your bags and will be responsible for putting you on another flight if your first flight is delayed.

article-info: What are Mash-Ups?
article-description: If you wanted to fly London to New York, we might find it’s cheaper to fly out with British Airways and back with Virgin Atlantic, rather than buy a return ticket with one airline. This is called a
article-description 3: mash-up. Just in case you’re interested.
article-description 4: Another kind of mash-up is what we call a
article-description 9: These are routes where you fly with different airlines, because it’s cheaper than booking with just one. For example:
article-description 10: If you wanted to fly London to Sydney, we might find it’s cheaper to fly London to Dubai with Emirates, and then Dubai to Sydney with Qantas, rather than booking the whole route with one airline.
article-description 11: Here at Skyscanner, we’re all about helping you have the best travel experience possible. And we know that saving money on flights is one easy way to make a happy traveller.
article-description 13: However, what’s really important to bear in mind is that mash-ups are
article-description 16: codeshares. A codeshare is when the airlines have an alliance. If anything goes wrong with the route — a delay, say, or a strike — those airlines will help you out at no extra cost. But mash-ups DO NOT involve an airline alliance. So if something goes wrong with a mash-up, it could cost you more money.
article-description 17: Are mash-ups better than other tickets?

article-info: How do I find the cheapest prices across a month?
article-description: The monthly prices feature lets you find the best deals by showing the cheapest prices across a month.
article-description 2: On our , you can find the monthly prices by clicking the  field and then clicking . Choose the month you’d like to traveland view the prices for that month.
article-description 8: The prices shown on the monthly prices feature are meant as a guide only. We hope you find the tool useful in finding the most affordable time to fly.
article-description 12: On our you can find the monthly prices by tapping the field and then Choose the month you want to travel and check out the prices for that month.
article-description 14: To find the month view on our , tap the  field, scroll down, and see the prices for the month you’d like to travel.
article-description 15: The monthly price feature only gives estimated prices. It stores prices found for a specific route and dates in the past four days. , the more.
article-description 16: How do I find the monthly prices feature?
article-description 17: that flight ticket prices and availability frequently change, which means the price on the results page might be different from what you saw in the month view. However, you select your travel dates and view the results, we will always show

article-info: How do I change my settings to English?
article-description: Skyscanner is available in more than 30 languages. If you wish to change your language settings, please follow these instructions.
article-description 2: On our , click on the  at the top of the website. You will see a drop-down list where you can select your preferred language.
article-description 12: On our  you can change the language by logging in to your profile and then clicking to access the Regional settings, or you can access the Regional settings by scrolling down to the website footer.
article-description 14: On our  the language will initially match the language selected in your phone settings. You must change the language in your phone settings to view that language in your Skyscanner mobile app.

article-info: How do I change my language settings?
article-description: Skyscanner is available in more than 30 languages. If you wish to change your language settings, please follow these instructions:
article-description 2: On our , click on the at the top of the website. You'll see a drop-down list where you can select your preferred language.
article-description 12: On our , you can change the language by logging in to your profile and then clicking  to access the Regional settings, or you can also access the Regional settings by scrolling down to the website footer.
article-description 14: On our , the language will match the language selected in your phone settings. You must change the language in your phone settings to view that language in your Skyscanner mobile app.

article-info: I've found a problem on a flight provider’s website
article-description: If you are seeing an error, or if you are having problems trying to complete a booking on a travel provider’s website please contact them directly for support as we don’t have any control over other websites. The search box below can help you find the contact details for the travel provider you booked with.

article-info: I've found a problem on Skyscanner
article-description: We are sorry to hear that you are having problems using Skyscanner. We’d encourage you to have a read through the below information, but if it doesn’t help, please contact us and let us know as many details as you can (including screenshots if possible) and our technical team will look into it.
article-description 2: Although as a search engine we don’t set prices ourselves, we appreciate that price accuracy and transparency is something that is key to maintaining trust. We would recommend taking a look at , but of course if there is still something wrong, we’d love to hear from you and we’ll do our best to investigate.
article-description 3: clearing your browser cache and cookies
article-description 7: Missing airline, airport, route or travel provider
article-description 8: If you think we are missing an airline, airport, route or travel provider on Skyscanner, please let us know the specific details of what you think might be missing. We’re confident that we provide the most comprehensive coverage out there, and we’re always keen to hear about anything we might be missing.
article-description 12: If you have a problem while making your booking, we’d recommend contacting the flight provider you are booking with. Skyscanner doesn’t have access to airline and travel agent booking systems or websites. Of course if you’re struggling to reach them, please contact us using the button below and we’ll do our best to help out.
article-description 14: Sometimes, website issues can be caused by browser-related problems. These can often be solved by . If this doesn’t work, please contact us and we will investigate further.
article-description 15: 90% of app problems can be rectified by uninstalling and reinstalling the app. We would recommend trying this first, but of course please do contact us if you’re still having problems.
article-description 17: We’re sorry if you appear to have been blocked from using Skyscanner; please contact us and provide your IP address and we’ll investigate ASAP.

article-info: Why have I been blocked from accessing the Skyscanner website?
article-description: Skyscanner’s websites are  many millions of times a day which has a detrimental effect on the service we’re able to provide. To prevent this, we use a bot blocking solution which checks to ensure you’re using the website in a normal manner.
article-description 2: Occasionally, this may mean that a genuine user may be wrongly flagged as a bot. This can be for a number of potential reasons, including, but not limited to:
article-description 3: You’re using a VPN which we have had to block due to excessive bot traffic in the past
article-description 6: You’re using our website at super speed which manages to beat our rate limits
article-description 8: You have a plug-in on your browser which could be interfering with how our website interacts with you as a user
article-description 12: If you've been blocked during normal use, please send us your IP address (this website may help: ), the website you’re accessing (e.g. ) and the date/time this happened, via the Contact Us button below and we’ll look into it as quickly as possible.

article-info: When I get redirected to a provider’s website the currency is different
article-description: Skyscanner lets you choose any currency you like to view prices and compare flights, but some airline and travel agent websites will only show their prices or allow payment in a limited number of currencies. If these flights are shown on Skyscanner, you should be able to book them.
article-description 2: Please bear in mind that if you pay for a flight in a currency that’s different from the currency your bank or card issuer uses, the currency conversion will be done by your bank or credit card company. They may use a different exchange rate to Skyscanner, and may charge commission. You should contact your bank if you want to find out about the exchange rate that will apply to you.

article-info: Can I book in my currency?
article-description: Skyscanner supports over 150 currencies on our  and .
article-description 2: Not all airlines and travel agents may offer your preferred currency for booking. Some countries share a currency symbol (e.g., US$, CA$ and AU$). We’ll always try to make this clear, but make sure you check the currency you’re paying in once on the travel provider’s website.
article-description 12: If you see flights on Skyscanner, you can book them with our travel provider in the displayed currency, and your bank or card issuer will set the exchange rate.
article-description 14: We would recommend you contact your bank or card issuer if you’d like to find out more about any exchange rate and possible fees you would have to pay for any transactions in another currency.

article-info: Missing currency
article-description: If you think we are missing a currency on the site please let us know via the contact us button below and we will add it to the site and apps as soon as we can.
